radiographic_examinations.findings: Thinning of the entire cornea; heterogeneous and mildly elevated stromal layer density.

Increased corneal curvature in both eyes; right eye maximum keratometric power of 50.5 D, left eye 50.60 D; right eye minimum corneal thickness of 285 µm with astigmatism (-4.4D at 174 degrees); left eye minimum corneal thickness of 280 µm with astigmatism (-3.9 D at 11 degrees); white to white value of 11.6 mm in the right eye and 11.7 mm in the left eye.
Significant increase in optical density in the 2-mm central area of the cornea; right eye 29.3 grayscale units (GSU), left eye 30.6 GSU.

Corneal epithelial cell morphology in the central cornea zone was disturbed; disordered nerve fibers under the basal cells; significant reduction in the number of stromal cells in the anterior cornea; highly reflective fibrotic structures observed.
